Mr. Wheeler of tne Associated Ethyl Company, accompanied by Mr. Cessford- of the Anglo-Iranian Oil Company, called on me this morning. They informed me that they were leaving by air today en route for Kuwait to explore' the possibilities of finding a suitable site for their plant there. They told me that although it was of advantage to locate an ethyl plant in the neighbourhood of a refinery it was quite practicable, with certain modifications, to operate from the natural gases of an oil field. 3. From his general attitude, Mr. Wheeler gave me the impression that he anticipated difficulties over labour if his plant were located in Bahrain particularly In view of the large construction programme contemplated in the near future by the Bahrain petroleum Company. 4. Mr. Wheeler informed me that the Arabian American Oil Company had told him that they would welcome the location of the ethyl plant in their area. He added that from the technical point of view, a suitable site could be found there, but that political and labour difficulties in S^udi Arabia were likely to be considerable. I then took the opportunity of saying that his Company would probably encounter considerable difficulties of this sort in either Saudi Arabia or Iran and that they would be likely to find things far easier in Kuwait or Bahrain. Mr. Cessford .volunteered the statement that chough he had not seen Kuwait he thought it likely that they would find Kuwait the most suitable place to locate their plant. ^ 5. I gave no written answers to the points raised in the questionnaire which forms the enclosure to the letter sent to you under my printed Letter No. c/352, dated the 31st July, 1947. I answered the queries listed under the heading of Local Regulations verbally, and informed them that although I could not give detailed answers to the queries listed under the heading of concessions, should the Company later be authorised to negotiate a concession either here or in Kuwait they would be given every assistance possible by the political authorities concerned. ATTESTED. Sd./- H.D.H. RANGE Political Agent, Bahrain. for Assistant Political Agent, Bahrain. NS.

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/38 Concession for Associated Ethyl Company in Bahrain'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically. There are file notes at the end, on folios 13-14. The notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 15; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-10; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Agent at Bahrain and the Political Residency in Bahrain, concerning the possibility of granting to the Associated Ethyl Company a concession to manufacture ethyl fluid from sea water in Bahrain and sell it to the oil companies.
